item.title: "Multiplayer Only" Popucom Brings Co-Op Action To Switch eShop Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Following its recent Nintendo Direct reveal

There were all sorts of announcements during Nintendo's September Direct, but one you might have missed was for an upcoming eShop release known as Popucom by Gryphline.

It's described as a multiplayer co-op platform adventure title, where you'll need to master "techniques of colour switching and match-3 shooting" to overcome puzzles and defeat enemies. There's also support for motion-assisted aiming with the Switch's gyroscopic sensors.

In an update today, the game has locked in a release date, with the developer confirming it will be arriving for Switch 4th December 2025.

According to the US eShop, this digital release will set you back $19.99 (or your regional equivalent) and requires around 4.3 GB of space on the Switch and Switch 2. Additionally, it supports single-system multiplayer for 2 to 4 players, and online play for 2 to 4 players.

Would you be interested in this upcoming release? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Bluesky

item.title: My Nintendo Store Adds A Kirby Air Riders Reward For Switch Online Members (US)
item.content:encoded:
Kirby Switch Online icons also released

To celebrate the arrival of Kirby Air Riders on the Switch 2 this week, the My Nintendo Store in the US has added a new reward.

This time it's a Kirby Air Riders keychain. It will set you back 600 Platinum Points (shipping fees apply) and is available "while supplies last". Here's the official description, along with a look:

"Celebrate the fast-paced vehicle action game with this dynamic accessory, showcasing Kirby™ on his Warp Star machine, ready to boost and spin into action. It's presented on a stylish navy strap featuring the official Kirby Air Riders logo, making it the perfect way to carry your passion for the game."

Keychain charm size: 3" x 3", Strap length: 6", Package size: H6" x W5"

As part of the Kirby Air Riders launch celebrations, Nintendo has also released a new batch of Switch Online icons. Wave 1 is available now and will be followed by four other waves. These icons will set you back 10 Platinum Points each.

Will you be checking out Kirby Air Riders this week? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Switch Port Specialist Panic Button Reveals It Helped Upgrade Multiple First-Party Games For Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
"Nintendo asked us to help"

Video game studio Panic Button has revealed it was selected by Nintendo to help update "marquee" Switch titles for Switch 2.

The talented team confirmed this in an official announcement on social media this week. Nintendo asked the studio to "help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system" while remaining faithful to the original versions of each title.

As you can see, the titles Panic Button helped release updates for include New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe, Super Mario Odyssey, Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury and ARMS. These upgrades included visual and frame rate improvements, HDR support, and various Switch 2 features.

These were all free upgrades, with multiple other first-party Switch titles receiving similar Switch 2 launch updates.

Panic Button, as you might recall, worked wonders during the Switch generation - porting titles such as DOOM Eternal, Wolfenstein II, Warframe and Rocket League. So, it's nice to see its efforts haven't gone unnoticed. Its official website has also been updated to include its Switch 2 work.

If we hear about Panic Button's involvement in anything else related to Switch 2 going forward, we'll provide an update.

Do you think Panic Button has done a good job on these Switch game upgrades for Switch 2? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Reminder: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds SpongeBob SquarePants DLC Now Available
item.content:encoded:
More racers are on the way

If Kirby isn't your thing, perhaps you would rather return to Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds to try out the new SpongeBob SquarePants Pack.

This paid DLC pack is now officially available on the Nintendo Switch. It contains SpongeBob SquarePants and Patrick Star as playable characters, a patty wagon vehicle, a themed Bikini Bottom course, new SpongeBob-inspired music tracks, and six different emotes for each character.

If you already own the Digital Deluxe Edition of Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds, you'll automatically receive this content. Else, you can purchase the Season Pass for $29.99, or the standalone pack for $5.99 / £4.99 (or your regional equivalent).

This latest DLC update will be followed by the Switch 2 game upgrade on 4th December 2025. You can find out more about this in our previous story.

Will you be taking a trip to Bikini Bottom in Sonic Racing this week? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.
